intro.description: Learn a new guitar chord every day
intro.lesson_description: Before we learn chords, let's understand the basics about the guitar. This lesson is fundamental for your success!
intro.body: Body: The larger part that amplifies the sound
intro.neck: Neck: Where you press the strings
intro.bridge: Bridge: Where the strings attach to the body
intro.headstock: Headstock: Where the tuning pegs are located
intro.frets: Frets: The metal divisions on the neck
intro.anatomy_tip: Familiarize yourself with these parts. Each one plays an important role in sound production and your playing technique.
intro.strings_tip: Strings are counted from bottom to top when you're holding the guitar normally.
intro.position_leg: Rest the guitar on your right leg (or use a footstool)
intro.position_right_arm: Right arm over the guitar body
intro.position_left_hand: Left hand on the neck, thumb behind
intro.position_left_desc: Left Hand: Forms a "C" with thumb behind the neck
intro.position_right_desc: Right Hand: Relaxed, fingers curved over the strings
intro.diagrams_description: Diagrams show where to place your fingers on the guitar neck:
intro.diagrams_dots: Black dots: Where to press the strings
intro.diagrams_numbers: Numbers: Indicate which finger to use (1=index, 2=middle, 3=ring, 4=pinky)
intro.diagrams_tip: Always press the strings just behind the fret (not on top of it) to get a clean, clear sound.
intro.congratulations: Congratulations! Now you can start learning chords.
intro.checklist_anatomy: I know the parts of the guitar
intro.checklist_strings: I know the names of the strings
intro.checklist_position: I know how to hold the guitar correctly
intro.checklist_diagrams: I know how to read chord diagrams
intro.next_lesson_preview: Your first chord - clean sound from the start
